lien.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the legal right to keep something that belongs to someone who owes you money, until the debt has been paid
lien.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a person’s or organization’s right to another’s property, usually the right of a lender to take a borrower’s property if they fail to repay a loan, or the right of people owed money by a company to take the assets of that company if it goes out of business
lien.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It currently owes about $225 million to its lenders, who hold liens on all of the company’s real estate assets.
lien.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to ask a law court to recognize that someone owes you money and to give you the right to take their assets to pay the debt
lien.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The city will file liens and judgments against properties that are one year behind in payment.
The carrier may exercise a lien on the cargo for the unpaid freight.
